channel.title: Posts on securi(tty)
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on securi(tty)

item.title: D.I.P.
item.description: Changed my mind to make D.I.P. instead of doing presentation during the Hack Day for workshops (which is still valid idea). This project is named after DevSecOps In A Pill, basically shell wrapper to include in development pipeline that for now has three basic functions: scan remote web target for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations look for vupnerable dependencies used in project (OWASP Dependency Check) search for sensitive exposed secrets in git repositories

item.title: DVNA
item.description: As a project for upcoming company’s internal hackday I chose to make workshops for secure coding in JavaScript, based on OWASP TOP 10 and Damn Vulnerable NodeJS Application. While I’m no coder by myself, I thought I might prepare as much I can from security perspective and use some feeback from more knowledgeable collegue in terms of code itself. The idea came when I stumbled upon “solution” book to DVNA itself from AppSeco.
